versos: (nights) Psalm 16:7 - I will praise the Lord, who counsels me; even at night my heart instructs me.;;;
(selfsame) Mark 14:13 - "And he sendeth forth two of his disciples, and saith unto them, Go ye into the city, and there shall meet you a man bearing a pitcher of water: follow him.";;;
(elon) Judges 4:11 - Now Heber the Kenite had moved away from the other Kenites
(bilhah) Genesis 35:22 - While Israel was living in that region
(thee) He restoreth my soul: he leadeth me in the paths of righteousness for his name's sake. - Psalm 23:3 KJV;;;
(bird) Psalm 124:7 - "We have escaped like a bird from the fowlers snare; the snare has been broken, and we have escaped.";;;
(hills) Psalm 121:1 - I lift up my eyes to the hills.;;;
(covered) Psalm 32:1 - "Blessed is the one whose transgressions are forgiven, whose sins are covered.";;;
(upward) Philippians 3:14 - I press on toward the goal for the prize of the upward call of God in Christ Jesus.;;;
(prevail) Romans 8:37 - "No, in all these things we are more than conquerors through him who loved us.";;;
(remained) John 15:9 - "As the Father has loved me, so have I loved you. Now remain in my love.";;;
(returned) Acts 1:10 - They were looking intently up into the sky as he was going
(abated) Genesis 8:1 - "But God remembered Noah and all the wild animals and the livestock that were with him in the ark, and he sent a wind over the earth, and the waters abated.";;;
(raven) Genesis 8:7 - "...and sent out a raven, and it kept flying back and forth until the water had dried up from the earth.";;;
(dove) Genesis 8:11 - "and the dove came back to him in the evening, and behold, in her mouth was a freshly plucked olive leaf. So Noah knew that the waters had subsided from the earth.";;;
(sole) Genesis 19:20 - "Look, here is a town near enough to run to, and it is small. Let me flee to itit is very small, isnt it Then my life will be spared.;;;

(leaf) Ezekiel 47:12 - "Fruit trees of all kinds will grow on both banks of the river. Their leaves will not wither, nor will their fruit fail. Every month they will bear fruit, because the water from the sanctuary flows to them. Their fruit will serve for food and their leaves for healing.";;;
(reuben) Genesis 29:32 - "Leah conceived and bore a son, and she named him reuben; for she said, 'Because the Lord has looked upon my affliction; surely now my husband will love me.'";;;
